thread.title: Geneva hoping to hand Case Western first conference loss
thread.title_full: Geneva hoping to hand Case Western first conference loss

author: Lauren Kirschman lkirschman@timesonline.com
title: Geneva hoping to hand Case Western first conference loss
text:
Photo by Sally Maxson of The Times 
Geneva quarterback Aaron Channing 
Game info: 7 p.m. Saturday, Reeves Field 
Records: Case Western 4-1, 4-0 PAC; Geneva 2-3, 1-2 
On the air: None 
What's on the line: Geneva will look to hand Case Western its first conference loss. Last week, the Golden Tornadoes led No. 11 Thomas More until the final seconds of the first half and went into halftime trailing 9-7. But Thomas More came out after the break and dominated, winning 44-14. 
Inside the playbook: Case Western is a well-rounded team that ranks second in the conference in scoring offense and scoring defense. Quarterback Rob Cuda is second in passing (260.0 yards per game) and seventh in rushing (89.2). For Geneva, quarterback Aaron Channing ranks fourth in the conference in passing with 186.8 yards per game and Dylan Jones is ninth in rushing (48.8). 
Key player: The Geneva defense will need to slow Case Western’s offense, and junior Jimmy Quinlan led Geneva with 18 tackles last week. 
Key stat: Case Western’s Cody Calhoun averages 28.2 yards per kickoff return, which ranks first in the conference. Geneva’s Noah Wertz averages 57.8 yards per kickoff and limits opponents’ starting position to the 29-yard line. More information
